intro: Trianthema govindia, commonly known as the Indian sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small yellow flowers. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy soils. It has a shallow root system that allows it to absorb moisture efficiently from the soil. Trianthema govindia is also known for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional Ayurvedic practices.
